events.event_name: January HCOB Eurozone Construction PMI Release
events.description: The HCOB Eurozone Construction PMI fell to 45.3 in January from 47.4 in December.
Employment in the construction sector rose for the first time since February 2023.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Eurozone Construction PMI fell to 45.3 in January from 47.4 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Eurozone Construction PMI fell to 45.3 in January from 47.4 in December

facts.fact_text: Input costs rose at the fastest pace since April 2023.

evidences.evidence_text: Input costs rose at the fastest pace since April 2023, driven by higher operating expenses across Italy, France and Germany.

facts.fact_text: Employment in the construction sector rose for the first time since February 2023.

evidences.evidence_text: employment rose for the first time since February 2023 as firms in Germany and Italy added staff

facts.fact_text: Commercial activity posted its biggest fall since November 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: commercial activity posting its biggest fall since November 2024

claims.claim_text: Demand remained weak and new orders declined.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: demand remained weak and new orders declined

claims.claim_text: Overall sentiment remained pessimistic though slightly less negative than in recent months.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: overall sentiment remained pessimistic though slightly less negative than in recent months
